questions.text: A 50-year-old diabetic male presents with fever, headache and right eyelid pain. Examination reveals vesicles in upper eye lid, forehead and nose on the right side of face consistent with herpes zoster. Which of the following nerves is likely involved:

Which of the Following marked structures is Safety muscle?

A 36 years old man was referred to the Head and Neck surgery outpatient clinic for the evaluation of cervical mass on the right side. A fine needle aspiration (FNA) puncture was performed and the result was thyroid papillary cell carcinoma. Accordingly the surgeon decided that he should undergo total thyroidectomy. The right inferior thyroid artery was identified. Careful dissection was done to find the right recurrent laryngeal nerve in the area between inferior thyroid artery and mid-cervical (mid-tracheal) line, but no recurrent nerve was observed. So with doubt to have the anatomical variation (non-recurrent laryngeal nerve), the area above the inferior thyroid artery was dissected. What is the embryological cause of this variation?
Glucosuria happens when the venous blood glucose fixation exceeds:
Which one of the following statements concerning glycolysis is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The conversion of glucose to lactate requires the presence of oxygen.

options.label: B
options.text: Hexokinase is important in hepatic glucose metabolism only in the absorptive period following consumption of a carbohydrate-containing meal.

options.label: C
options.text: Fructose 2,6-bisphosphate is a potent inhibitor of phosphofructokinase.

options.label: D
options.text: The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.

questions.correct_answer: D. The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • A. Hexokinase, phosphofructokinase, and pyruvate kinase are all irreversible and are the regulated steps in glycolysis.
  • • B. The conversion of glucose to lactate (anaerobic glycolysis) is a process that does not involve a net oxidation or reduction and, thus, oxygen is not required.
  • • C. Glucokinase (not hexokinase) is important in hepatic glucose metabolism only in the absorptive period following consumption of a carbohydrate-containing meal.
  • • D. Fructose 2,6-bisphosphate is a potent activator (not inhibitor) of phosphofructokinase.

His vitals are stable and abdominal examination was insignificant. On evaluation he had leucocytosis (TLC 14,800) with predominant neutrophilia (P86, L8). His liver function test revealed serum bilirubin of 7.2 mg/dL and SGOT and SGPT levels of 48 and 56 (reference range SGOT/SGPT 22/24). He had marked elevation of serum alkaline phosphatase of 55 KA units (reference range 11–13 KA units). His renal function test was normal. His blood culture was sterile. options.text: It is due to an excess periosteal reaction by an extremely sensitive periosteum

options.label: C
options.text: It represents a subacute form of osteomyelitis

options.label: D
options.text: Most of the cases respond well to conservative management

questions.correct_answer: C. It represents a subacute form of osteomyelitis

questions.text: A 7 year old boy is brought by parents to Ortho OPD with chief complains of dull aching pain and inability to squat. His problems started with intense pain in the right hip two weeks ago for which he was treated conservatively and symptomatically. His blood investigations show raised ESR with other counts almost normal. X-rays were done which showed osteopenia and mild erosions around the hip joint mainly towards the acetabular side. Which of the following is the correct diagnosis?
About fracture healing, all are true, except :

options.label: A
options.text: Lower limb long bones heal faster than other bones

options.label: B
options.text: Fracture in children heal faster than in adults

options.label: C
options.text: Oblique and spiral fractures heal faster than transverse fractures

questions.correct_answer: A. Lower limb long bones heal faster than other bones

A 20-year-old male patient of RHD with mitral stenosis presents with palpitations perceived as increased rate. On examination pulse rate is 100/min, irregular while heart rate is 120/min. On JVP a wave is not seen. What is the most likely cause of this finding?

A 60 year old woman presented with fatigue and dyspnea on exertion.She has pulsus alternans,raised JVP and S3 gallop.On echocardiography ejection fraction is 30% with dilated heart chambers.Which of the following drug will improve mortality in this patient

A 40 year old male with past history of ulcerative colitis presented with yellow sclera, dark urine and pruritis. Liver function shows serum bilirubin 5 mg/dl, SGPT- 50 IU/L and ALP- 800 IU/L. Liver biopsy showed the following findings. What is the most likely cause.
A patient presented with altered sensorium in emergency department. Pulse rate is 42/min,BP-100/60 mmHg, ECG is done as shown in the figure. What is the most likely cause of this change?
You are posted in hepatitis clinic. Your professor asked you to calculate Leipzig score in a 15 year old male patient. Which is the most likely disease patient is suffering from

A patient presented with dyspnea on exertion and has a mid diastolic murmur at apex which increases on expiration and passive leg raising.All of the following the clinical findings are consistent with severe mitral stenosis except
questions.correct_answer: C. Opening snap late after S2

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding Brainerd diarrhoea except

options.label: C
options.text: Subtle inflammation of distal small intestine and colon

questions.text: Which of the following disorders will cause an increase in functional residual capacity?

A 55-year-old man with a recent right-sided partial colectomy for stage 1 colon cancer comes back into the emergency room because of nausea and vomiting. Initial x-ray shows dilated loops of small bowel with air fluid levels. A nasogastric tube is placed and the following labs are obtained. Which of the following metabolic acid-base disorders does this patient have?

A 62-year-old man presents to the emergency department complaining of a droopy right eye and blurred vision. He smokes one pack of cigarettes daily. He has chronic daily sputum production and stable dyspnea on exertion. On physical examination, he has right eye ptosis with unequal pupils. His pupil is 2 mm on the right and not reactive, whereas the left pupil is 4 mm and reactive. On extremity examination, there is wasting of the intrinsic muscles of the hand. He was also complaining right chest pain . Which of the following would be most likely to explain the patient’s constellation of symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: Enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes causing occlusion of the superior vena cava

options.label: B
options.text: Metastases to the brain from small-cell lung cancer

options.label: D
options.text: Right apical mass like density measuring 1 cm in thickness

questions.correct_answer: D. Right apical mass like density measuring 1 cm in thickness

questions.text: A 57-year-old man with known very severe COPD who continues to smoke cigarettes presents to his doctor with increasing weight gain and bilateral lower leg edema over several weeks. On examination, he has an elevated jugular venous pulsation and bilateral lower leg edema that extend to his knees. An electrocardiogram shows right ventricular hypertrophy . Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic test at this time?

options.label: B
options.text: CT scan of the chest without contrast

questions.text: A 30 year old presented with features of acute pancreatitis. Few days later he developed dyspnea. His chest Xray is shown below. The probable respiratory failure is ?

A 65 yr old male with previous history of a CVA presents with 6 week history of SOB , cough productive of foul smelling sputum, intermittent fevers and fevers and wt loss. He has been by his family physician but to no effect & several times has prescribed several antibiotics. His CXR is given. True regarding his condition : A. The posterior upper lobes and superior lower lobes of right lung are the most common locations of the disease B. The recommended treatment is with linezolid C. Aspiration is the most common risk factor . D. Mycobacterium tuberculosis is the most common organism responsible. Select the right combination

options.label: A
options.text: If A, B, C are correct

options.label: B
options.text: If A and C are correct

options.label: C
options.text: If B and D are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four (A, B, C, & D) are correct

questions.correct_answer: B. If A and C are correct

questions.text: Which of the following sentence is incorrect regarding the following clinical sign?

options.label: A
options.text: This sign is called as Barre’s sign

options.label: B
options.text: This sign is positive even in mild lesion of corticospinal tract lesion

options.label: C
options.text: Above patient is having lesion in right cerebellum

options.label: D
options.text: This sign is called as pronator drift

questions.correct_answer: C. Above patient is having lesion in right cerebellum

questions.text: Which of the following is true about clinical features of Huntington disease ?

options.label: A
options.text: The severity of chorea coorelates with disease progression.

options.label: B
options.text: Chorea is the most disabling symptom.

options.label: D
options.text: Apraxia is the earliest sign of cognitive impairement.

questions.correct_answer: C. Executive function is selectively lost.

questions.text: A 45 year old alcoholic male is diagnosed with TBM and is started on ATT therapy for the same.On follow up in OPD after 1 week of discharge from the hospital which of the following test should be advised.
Werding-hoffman disease is the name given to

A patient is diagnosed with pituitary adenoma on MRI .His serum cortisol is high and shows positive response on high dose dexamethasone test .Which of the following is best line of management for the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Advise IPSS to locate the pituitary tumour.

options.label: B
options.text: Advise for transsphenoidal resection of pituitary.

options.label: D
options.text: Advise PET scan to find primary malignancy.

questions.correct_answer: B. Advise for transsphenoidal resection of pituitary.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a specific symptom of Cushing syndrome

A 60-year-old man eats a healthy meal. Approximately 40 minutes later the ileocecal sphincter relaxes, and the chyme moves into the cecum. Gastric distension leads to relaxation of the ileocecal sphincter by way of which of the following reflex?

A 10-year-old boy jumps off a ledge at a height of 6 feet from the ground and lands on the balls of his feet. The increase in muscle tension causes a sudden, complete relaxation of the affected muscles. Which sensory receptor is most likely to mediate this relaxation when the muscle tension is increased?
An 80-year-old man with h/o smoking 40 cigarettes per day for last 50 years, is diagnosed with chronic pulmonary emphysema. Which of the following is likely to be seen in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased elastic recoil of the lungs

questions.text: Which of the following will occur during exercise?

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased release of epinephrine by the adrenals

questions.text: If the prevalence is very low as compared to the incidence for a disease, it implies:

options.label: A
options.text: Disease is very fatal and / or easily curable

options.label: C
options.text: Calculation of prevalence & incidence is wrong

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing can be said, as they are independent

questions.correct_answer: A. Disease is very fatal and / or easily curable

questions.text: The investigator wants to assess an association between obesity and breast cancer. The study best suited for this purpose which is less time consuming is :

An epidemiologist wants to assess the effect of tea drinking on blood pressure. He decides to do an intervention study. Which of the following measures does not increase the internal validity of the study?

options.label: A
options.text: Careful monitoring of blood pressure during the study

options.label: D
options.text: Random selection of participants from the general population

questions.correct_answer: D. Random selection of participants from the general population

questions.text: Which of the following is correctly matched for type of vaccine mentioned :
Which of the following is true for IFA supplementation under WIFS ( as a part of I-NIPI ) :

On physical examination, she has an audible friction rub on auscultation of the chest, along with a faint systolic murmur. A 40 year old male presented with 10 days history of fever, severe joint pains and headache. He was treated with antibiotics by a doctor previously but he didn’t respond. On examination he was found to have high BP, features of inflammatory arthritis in large joints, gangrene in 2 fingers of upper limb and a skin lesion as given in the picture below. Investigations revealed high creatinine without proteinuria or haematuria. ANA and ANCA were negative. HbsAg turned out to be +ve but the patient ultimately succumbed to abdominal perforation. What is the likely diagnosis ?
Which of the following is not true about Renal Tubular Acidosis ?

options.label: D
options.text: RTA 3 has Carbonic anhydrase II deficiency
